bug.author: mitchharvey
bug.summary: Trying to run in docker fails, possibly an issue with python3.8
bug.description:
‚ö†Ô∏èIMPORTANT‚ö†Ô∏è if you do not fill this out, we will automatically delete your issue. We will not help anyone that cannot fill out this template.
Have you read our Wiki page "Common Issues & Their Solutions"?
yes Describe the bug Not working with docker. Running the exact command referenced in the documentation: docker run -it --rm remnux/ciphey "=MXazlHbh5WQgUmchdHbh1EIy9mZgQXarx2bvRFI4VnbpxEIBBiO4VnbNVkU" Returns: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/bin/ciphey", line 8, in <module> sys.exit(main()) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 829, in __call__ return self.main(*args, **kwargs) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 782, in main rv = self.invoke(ctx) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1066, in invoke return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 610, in invoke return callback(*args, **kwargs) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/ciphey.py", line 221, in main config.complete_config() File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/iface/_config.py", line 196, in complete_config self.load_objs() File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/iface/_config.py", line 141, in load_objs self.objs["checker"] = self(_fwd.registry.get_named(self.checker, PolymorphicChecker)) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/iface/_config.py", line 112, in __call__ return self.instantiate(t) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/iface/_config.py", line 107, in instantiate ret = t(self) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/iface/_modules.py", line 163, in __init__ self._base = cls(config) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/basemods/Checkers/ezcheck.py", line 50, in __init__ self.checkers.append(config(Brandon)) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/iface/_config.py", line 112, in __call__ return self.instantiate(t) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/iface/_config.py", line 107, in instantiate ret = t(self) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/iface/_modules.py", line 163, in __init__ self._base = cls(config) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/basemods/Checkers/brandon.py", line 191, in __init__ self.top1000Words = config.get_resource(self._params().get("top1000")) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/iface/_config.py", line 206, in get_resource return self(_fwd.registry.get_named(loader, ResourceLoader))(name) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/iface/_modules.py", line 282, in __call__ return self.getResource(*args) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ciphey/basemods/Resources/cipheydists.py", line 32, in getResource return self._getters[prefix](name) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/cipheydists/__init__.py", line 19, in get_list return json.loads(pkgutil.get_data(__name__, os.path.join("list", name) + ".json")) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/json/__init__.py", line 357, in loads return _default_decoder.decode(s) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/json/decoder.py", line 337, in decode obj, end = self.raw_decode(s, idx=_w(s, 0).end()) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/json/decoder.py", line 355, in raw_decode raise JSONDecodeError("Expecting value", s, err.value) from None json.decoder.JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0) </denchmark-code>
Plaintext ‚ö†Ô∏èIMPORTANT‚ö†Ô∏è The below code is non-negotiable for "Ciphey didn't decrypt...." problems. If you do not tell us your plaintext, we will not help you. <denchmark-code>Not sure what the plaintext is, it was the example from the documentation </denchmark-code>
Version ‚ö†Ô∏èIMPORTANT‚ö†Ô∏è We need this information because different environments will induce different bugs in Ciphey
OS/Distro: macOS Catalina Python version: 3.8 Ciphey versions: Whatever version is in docker right now Did you use Docker? Yes
<denchmark-link:https://pastebin.com/TMVDnk4f>https://pastebin.com/TMVDnk4f</denchmark-link>
To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
What input did you use? docker run -it --rm remnux/ciphey "=MXazlHbh5WQgUmchdHbh1EIy9mZgQXarx2bvRFI4VnbpxEIBBiO4VnbNVkU" What flags / arguments did you use? No extra flags or arguments
Expected behavior To see ciphey decrypt or at least attempt to decrypt the input
Related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Ciphey/Ciphey/issues/398>#398</denchmark-link> . But I actually filled out the template.

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.79. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/Ciphey/Ciphey>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

I found a workaround by using a different docker base image python:3.7.9-slim-buster So the full dockerfile would just be: <denchmark-code>FROM python:3.7.9-slim-buster LABEL version="1.1" LABEL description="Ciphey - An Automated Decoding and Decryption Tool" LABEL maintainer="Lenny Zeltser" ENV LANG C.UTF-8 ENV LANGUAGE C.UTF-8 ENV LC_ALL C.UTF-8
USER root
RUN pip3 install --upgrade pip && \ pip3 install --upgrade ciphey && \ groupadd -r nonroot && \ useradd -m -r -g nonroot -d /home/nonroot -s /usr/sbin/nologin -c "Nonroot User" nonroot && \ mkdir -p /home/nonroot/workdir && \ chown -R nonroot:nonroot /home/nonroot
USER nonroot ENV HOME /home/nonroot WORKDIR /home/nonroot/workdir VOLUME ["/home/nonroot/workdir"] ENV USER nonroot ENTRYPOINT ["/usr/local/bin/ciphey"] CMD ["--help"] </denchmark-code>
This doesn't fix the issue, since ciphey should be able to work with python3.8, but this is a possible temporary workaround

Hi! I'm only just being drafted in to have a look at this. Thanks for raising the issue, I understand what the problem is here. As it stands, Ciphey relies on REMnux's DockerHub Repo. We can't do any CI/testing and issues such as caching (which is where I think this problem specifically lays within) I'm going to be making Ciphey a little bit more self-sustainable in this regard over the next day or so.
This doesn't fix the issue, since Ciphey should be able to work with python3.8, but this is a possible temporary workaround
Exactly this for the time being! (: I've pushed a working build to cmnatic/ciphey in lieu of creating a Ciphey organisation tomorrow, in the mean while, you can see example usage below: docker run -it --rm cmnatic/ciphey =MXazlHbh5WQgUmchdHbh1EIy9mZgQXarx2bvRFI4VnbpxEIBBiO4VnbNVkU <denchmark-h:h3>Result on a brand new DO Droplet:</denchmark-h>
replace "=MXazlHbh5WQgUmchdHbh1EIy9mZgQXarx2bvRFI4VnbpxEIBBiO4VnbNVkU" with your value appropriately
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4163116/93396898-6273c000-f870-11ea-8525-6107aa1e2d49.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>As it stands, files cannot be parsed to Ciphey i.e. ciphey -f input.txt as I wasn't quite expecting to be anywhere near publishing yet.</denchmark-h>
The<denchmark-link:https://github.com/CMNatic/Ciphey/blob/cmn-dockerfile-py-deb10/Dockerfile> Dockerfile</denchmark-link> that this is created from is a "band-aid" until I can afford the time to implement all of the above ^^ (note how there are minuscule changes made from the REMnux Dockerfile, where it's accredited nonetheless) cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bee-san>@bee-san</denchmark-link>
